snippet.textDisplay: I'll admit I haven't played as much of this game as I should have (I have the game, but don't play it all that often), but I absolutely love this game's soundtrack. At my last job, I'd just listen to the entire soundtrack multiple times. Yasunori Mitsuda is an amazing composer.

snippet.textDisplay: I just wish the game was finished. I could tell it was incomplete when I played, but it still was an unparalleled experience like Chrono Trigger was. It definitely feels more refined before the end of the game where the balance between story, action and gameplay was kind of weakened.

snippet.textDisplay: He's absolutely right, you know? And that's not opinion but fact. I loved Chrono Cross as well simply because of its music and atmosphere, but there's no denying that it had tons of fault because Squaresoft didn't allow the producer to complete the game - this game was left at 75% because they decided to cut funding for it. Look it up.
snippet.textOriginal: He's absolutely right, you know? And that's not opinion but fact. I loved Chrono Cross as well simply because of its music and atmosphere, but there's no denying that it had tons of fault because Squaresoft didn't allow the producer to complete the game - this game was left at 75% because they decided to cut funding for it. Look it up.

snippet.textDisplay:
This song have been one of my absolute favorites. The epic feeling you get from it is overwhelming, it's impossible to match it.
The soundtrack from this game is the only one I got so many favorites. If I would pick my top 20 VGM's, I could easily fill the whole list with only Chrono Cross songs without thinking that a single song didn't deserve to be there, and no kidding here, I've been thinking that a lot.
My second favorite OST gotta be the Wild Arms series though

snippet.textDisplay: To all those who argue and get into heated conversations regarding which game is superior aesthetically and artistically, regarding substance and material (gameplay, the story/narrative, graphics, replayability) - let me ask you this: Does Square (formerly Squaresoft now Square Enix) ever dissapoint?  My childhood (am now 17) was defined by a few games - yet none had the emotional and psychological impact as "Kingdom Hearts" (Grand Theft Auto III as well).
snippet.textOriginal: To all those who argue and get into heated conversations regarding which game is superior aesthetically and artistically, regarding substance and material (gameplay, the story/narrative, graphics, replayability) - let me ask you this: Does Square (formerly Squaresoft now Square Enix) ever dissapoint?  My childhood (am now 17) was defined by a few games - yet none had the emotional and psychological impact as "Kingdom Hearts" (Grand Theft Auto III as well).

snippet.textDisplay:
@GeraldRobotnik That's the problem. You have to read a compendium to really see the links between the games. :/
I'm glad people can appreciate Chrono Cross, but personally, I did not like the gameplay too much. Most characters were lifeless and redundant and the battle system felt really boring and unnecessary. OST and Story are top notch, but the rest didn't cut it for me. :[
snippet.textOriginal:
@GeraldRobotnik That's the problem. You have to read a compendium to really see the links between the games. :/
I'm glad people can appreciate Chrono Cross, but personally, I did not like the gameplay too much. Most characters were lifeless and redundant and the battle system felt really boring and unnecessary. OST and Story are top notch, but the rest didn't cut it for me. :[

snippet.textDisplay: CT was and is a far superior game.  It's storyline actually made sense.  It was because of the subpar nature of CC that it was linked to CT to boost sales - their stories are completely separate and they should have never attempted to link them as the link does not make any sense whatsoever.
snippet.textOriginal: CT was and is a far superior game.  It's storyline actually made sense.  It was because of the subpar nature of CC that it was linked to CT to boost sales - their stories are completely separate and they should have never attempted to link them as the link does not make any sense whatsoever.

snippet.textDisplay:
Sub-par criticism can hardly give Chrono Cross or Chrono Trigger any justice.
Chrono Trigger was far from being sub-par when it came out. Even now it stands apart in the way it gives players a sense of timelessness, which coupled with its incredible graphics, storyline, gameplay, and music make it one of the best games ever.
However, that doesn't mean I won't pay homage to Chrono Cross, as it has everything you mentioned. It just feels pointless to compare the two, when both games are so good.
snippet.textOriginal:
Sub-par criticism can hardly give Chrono Cross or Chrono Trigger any justice.
Chrono Trigger was far from being sub-par when it came out. Even now it stands apart in the way it gives players a sense of timelessness, which coupled with its incredible graphics, storyline, gameplay, and music make it one of the best games ever.
However, that doesn't mean I won't pay homage to Chrono Cross, as it has everything you mentioned. It just feels pointless to compare the two, when both games are so good.
